== Manual Installation with Enhanced Security:==
=== Pre-requisites: ===
Update and upgrade your system:
``
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
``
Consider using a dedicated server or Raspberry Pi for better performance and security.
=== Install LAMP Stack:===
Apache web server:
``
 sudo apt install apache2
``
MySQL database:
``
 sudo apt install mysql-server
``
PHP and dependencies:
``
 sudo apt install php php-fpm php-mysql php-curl php-gd php-zip php-xml
``
Secure MySQL:

_Run the MySQL secure installation script_
``
sudo mysql_secure_installation
``
_and set strong, unique passwords for root, mariadb, phpmyadmin, and any other database users.
Avoid using the same password for multiple accounts or services._
=== Create Database for Nextcloud: ===
Log in to MySQL:
``
 sudo mysql -u root -p (use the strong password you set)
``
Create a database named nextcloud_db:
``
CREATE DATABASE nextcloud_db;
``
Create a user named nextcloud_user with access to the database:
``
SQL
CREATE USER nextcloud_user@localhost IDENTIFIED BY 'your_strong_password';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nextcloud_db.* TO nextcloud_user@localhost IDENTIFIED BY 'your_strong_password';
``
Use code with caution. Learn more
Replace 'your_strong_password' with a unique and complex password.
Exit MySQL:
``
 quit;
``
Download Nextcloud:
Download the latest version from the official website:
 https://nextcloud.com/install/:
 https://nextcloud.com/install/
Extract and Move Files:
Extract the downloaded file:
 ``
 tar -xf nextcloud-latest.tar.gz
``
Move the extracted directory to your web server's root:
``
sudo mv nextcloud /var/www/html/nextcloud
``
Set Ownership and Permissions:
Set ownership of the Nextcloud directory:
``
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/html/nextcloud
``
Set permissions for the data directory:
``
 sudo chmod -R 0750 /var/www/html/nextcloud/data
``
Enable and Restart Apache:
``
sudo systemctl enable apache2 && sudo systemctl restart apache2
``
Nextcloud Setup:
Open your web browser and go to http://localhost/nextcloud.
Complete the Nextcloud setup wizard using a strong, unique password different from your database credentials.
